title: John Dougherty (rugby league)
text:
John 'Jack' Dougherty (born 1931) is an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1950s.
Playing career.
A schoolboy product from <a href="Marist%20Brothers">Marist Brothers</a> <a href="Hamilton%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Hamilton</a>, he played for the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a> club in the <a href="NSWRFL%20Premiership">NSWRFL Premiership</a>. 
He was the and won 3 grand finals with the team. He scored 32 tries and 72 goals. A Sydney and New South Wales representative, Dougherty was also chosen to play for Australia but was injured forcing him out of that match.
